alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 11:57PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Laurel, Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1157 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Orlando, or over Mount Vernon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Orlando, Flat Rock, Dudley Station and Pine Hill around 1200 AM EDT. Donaro, Withers, Sinks, Johnetta, Gauley, Bummer and Climax around 1205 AM EDT. Robinet, Jep Hill, Cooksburg, Horse Lick, Goochland, Lamero and Threelinks around 1210 AM EDT. Dango, Loam, Ardery, Carico, Cruise, Templer, Eberle and Eglon around 1215 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Middlefork, Parrot, Collingsworth, Peoples, Sandgap, Shop Branch, Dabolt, Hurley, Deese, Cornelius, Waneta, Moores Creek, McKee, Atkinstown, Gray Hawk, Olin, Bradshaw, Mildred, Annville, Settle Store, Tyner and Bond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
